content.raw:
We are working with Gazebo 7 on Ubuntu 16.04 and ROS Kinetic.  When using release 7.0.0+dfsg-2, we could rotate our custom robot smoothly either with a joytstick or by sending Twist commands.  When we updated to release 7.14.0-1~xenial, rotations became horribly broken as you can see in [this video](https://youtu.be/kNZLOSvELg8) and [this video](https://youtu.be/wgqgdksxaQ4).  (The first video has the case on the robot and the second video is without the case.  Both behaviors are the same.)  In both videos, we are publishing a simple Twist message on /cmd_vel that has 0.1 in the angular.z component and 0 everywhere else.

We really need to get back to the previous behavior which was pure rotation around the vertical axis.

We are working with Gazebo 7 on Ubuntu 16.04 and ROS Kinetic. When using release 7.0.0+dfsg-2, we could rotate our custom robot smoothly either with a joytstick or by sending Twist commands. When we updated to release 7.14.0-1~xenial, rotations became horribly broken as you can see in this video and this video. (The first video has the case on the robot and the second video is without the case. Both behaviors are the same.) In both videos, we are publishing a simple Twist message on /cmd_vel that has 0.1 in the angular.z component and 0 everywhere else.

We really need to get back to the previous behavior which was pure rotation around the vertical axis.
